page.title: 04BINFIELD PARK HOSPITAL
page.content: Binfield Park was built in 1775 and was a private residence until it became a home for mentally handicapped adults in 1948. It can accomodate 50 residents, mostly from Berkshire, aged between 20 and 40. Most residents are able to go out on their own but some need supervision. On a typical day the residents wake at 7.00am, wash, dress and make beds before breakfast at 7.45. Transport arrives at 8.30am to take most of them to adult training centres, where they stay from 9.00am to 4.00pm. They have tea between 5.00pm and 6.00pm. Afterwards they enjoy various activities, Art, Reading, Writing, Swimming & Local Walks. There is a Youth Club with sporting facilities. They are generally in bed by 10.00pm.
